docs.text: robin williams , this time without a beard , returns to drama in this sloppy , sickly sweet fantasy with few redeeming features apart from the incredible effects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he plays chris nielsen , who meets annie ( annabella sciora ) and promptly marries her .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: they have two great kids , who sadly die in a car crash .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: just when it couldn't get any worse , chris gets killed in a car crash , and goes to heaven where he meets his guide albert ( gooding jnr . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: annie can't take the grief anymore , and kills herself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( all sounding like good fun so far ? )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the 'penalty' for suicide is to go to hell , and chris goes on a mission to try and rescue her using the help of the traveller ( max von sydow . )
docs.label: negative

docs.text: based on a novel by twilight zone writer richard matheson , what dreams may come is clunky , manufactured material doused with a extra load of sugar .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this is the worse spielberg film spielberg never made .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: everything is wrong about this movie : the performances are forced , and the audiences fail to relate to any of the characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: williams puts on a convincing upset face , but that's all it is : a face .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there's no emotion behind it .

docs.text: sciora's performance is lazy , and bogs down the whole film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: she may look pretty , but she can't act .

docs.text: max von sydow is o . k as the traveller , if nothing special .

docs.text: cuba gooding jnr , thankfully , adds some bounce to his performance , and is certainly the best performer in the film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's a shame that his character is so flat and 2-d , and offers no room for improvement .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: all the performers have to work with a soppy script , that tries it's best to get some emotion going , but never takes off the ground .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: there are _some_ scenes which could be real heartwarmers , but the faceless characters don't help to get anything out of the performers .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while films like e . t used great actors , music and direction to pull of a masterful heart-tugging scene , what dreams may come is haphazard , expecting the emotion to come out of the scene automatically .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: instead , it's all rather boring .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sure , the music is pretty ( by michael kamen ) and the cinematography isn't bad ( by eduardo serra ) but there's something lacking .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the script doesn't help , filled with hopeless romantic clich ? s , and dud speeches .

docs.text: richard matheson can write some awesome science fiction stories , sadly this novel would look embarrassed in a bargain bin , let alone being converted into a $70 million vehicle for robin williams .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: despite being set in heaven , what dreams may come is mightily depressing .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film rushes a happy ending , but everything before this is very , very sad and black , which just adds to make the ending even more hopeless and stupid .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but there's one redeeming feature about this failure of a movie : the special effects .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: heaven and hell are truly incredible places , and the actors fit perfectly with the virtual sets .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but despite this , what dreams may come , proves to be nothing but the biggest disappointment of 1998 .

docs.text: instead of raising questions about existence , it raises boredom .
